The type of pool you are describing is:
B. Fiberglass.

Fiberglass pools are prefabricated and do not require any framing construction. They are pre-molded into set shapes and sizes and are made from a fiberglass composite material that is durable and resistant to fading and cracking. To install a fiberglass pool, a hole is dug, plumbing is installed, and a sand base is laid. The pool is then lowered into the hole and leveled. Fiberglass pools have a higher initial cost than vinyl pools but may be more durable and require less maintenance over time. Concrete, above ground, and gunite pools are all different types of pools that may have different characteristics and installation processes.

19 Question (19/38)
Identify which type of pool is this: these pools appear very similar to Gunite pools but they are poured not sprayed. These pools require resurfacing more often than Gunite pools. Over time they become rough because of the chemicals used to sanitize the water and surfaces are quite susceptible to wear and tear when exposed to salt.

prevnext
Answers
A
Concrete
B
Fiberglass
C
Above Ground
D
Vinyl

The type of pool you are describing is:
A. Concrete.

Concrete pools are similar to gunite pools in that they are made from a mixture of cement and water. However, unlike gunite pools, which are sprayed onto a rebar frame, concrete pools are poured into a form. Concrete pools require resurfacing more often than gunite pools, as the surface of the pool can become rough over time due to the chemicals used to sanitize the water and the impact of exposure to salt. Concrete pools are known for their durability and versatility, but they can be more expensive to install and maintain than other types of pools. Fiberglass, above ground, and vinyl pools are all different types of pools that may have different characteristics and installation processes.

What is this shingle called? It has a smooth surface is created using a circular saw.

A
Wood Shake
B
Wood Shingle
C
Cedar Shake
D
Engineered Lumbar

Without more information, it is not possible for me to accurately identify the type of shingle you are describing. Wood shake and cedar shake are types of roofing shingles that are made by hand splitting or splitting wood using a hydraulic press, and they have a rustic, natural appearance. Wood shingles are thin, tapered pieces of wood that are used to cover roofs and walls, and they have a smooth surface that is usually created using a circular saw. Engineered lumber is a type of wood product that is made by combining wood fibers with adhesives and other materials to create a structural material that is stronger and more stable than natural wood. Each of these types of shingles has different characteristics and uses, and it is not possible to determine which one you are describing without more information.

22 Question (22/38)
Identify which type of pool is this: these pools are the more common pool options as they have the lowest initial cost of all pool installations. They are highly customizable and come in many shapes and sizes. The surface is soft to the touch and it is easy to clean. The disadvantages are that the liner has to be replaced every 7 to 15 years.

prevnext
Answers
A
Concrete
B
Fiberglass
C
Above Ground
D
Vinyl

The type of pool you are describing is:
D. Vinyl.

Vinyl pools are a common type of pool that is known for their low initial cost and high customization options. They are available in many shapes and sizes and are made from a durable, waterproof vinyl material that is easy to clean and soft to the touch. The main disadvantage of vinyl pools is that the liner, which is the waterproof layer that forms the inner surface of the pool, may need to be replaced every 7 to 15 years. Concrete, fiberglass, and above ground pools are all different types of pools that may have different characteristics and installation processes.

Question (25/38)

Which one of the following is not an indicator of the quality of vinyl fences also known as PVC fences?

prevnext
Answers
A
Wall thickness
B
Warranty
C
Detail
D
Color

One of the following is not an indicator of the quality of vinyl fences, also known as PVC fences:
D. Color.

Vinyl fences, also known as PVC fences, are made from a durable, weather-resistant plastic material that is available in a range of colors. While the color of a vinyl fence may be an important factor for some homeowners, it is not necessarily an indicator of the quality of the fence. Other factors that may be more important for determining the quality of a vinyl fence include wall thickness, warranty, and detail. Wall thickness refers to the thickness of the material used to construct the fence, and a thicker wall may be more durable and resistant to damage. A warranty can provide protection against defects or other issues that may arise with the fence, and a longer warranty may indicate a higher level of quality. Detail refers to the level of craftsmanship and attention to detail in the construction of the fence, and a fence with good detail may be more durable and aesthetically pleasing.

Question (26/38)
A natural process occurs to wood shingles. The wood expands and contracts due to environmental changes such as temperature and moisture. If the hail damage is minor, the wood may take care of the damage by itself. What is this natural process known as?

prevnext
Answers
A
Weathering
B
Expansion
C
Contracting
D
Splashes

The natural process you are describing, in which wood expands and contracts due to changes in temperature and moisture, is known as:
A. Weathering.

Weathering is the process by which wood and other materials are naturally affected by their environment, including changes in temperature, moisture, and other factors. Over time, these changes can cause wood to expand and contract, which can lead to changes in the appearance, shape, and structural integrity of the wood. In some cases, minor hail damage to wood shingles may be repaired by the natural weathering process as the wood expands and contracts. Other factors that can affect the weathering of wood include exposure to sunlight, wind, and precipitation. Understanding the weathering process and how it can impact wood materials can help homeowners to better maintain and protect their wood shingles and other wood structures.

27 Question (27/38)
Which one of the following fences is relatively inexpensive, easy to repair and can endure the elements?

prevnext
Answers
A
Wrought Iron
B
Chain Link
C
Vinyl
D
Iron

One type of fence that is relatively inexpensive, easy to repair, and can endure the elements is:
B. Chain link.

Chain link fences are a popular choice for many homeowners due to their low cost, ease of installation, and durability. They are made from galvanized steel wire that is woven together to form a mesh, and they can be coated with a variety of materials to protect against rust and other types of damage. Chain link fences are relatively easy to repair, as any damaged sections can be replaced or repaired without the need to replace the entire fence. They are also relatively low maintenance, as they do not require painting or staining like other types of fences. Additionally, chain link fences are known for their ability to withstand the elements and can be used in a variety of climates and conditions. Other types of fences that may be relatively inexpensive and durable include vinyl, wood, and aluminum, but they may have different characteristics and installation requirements.

28 Question (28/38)
Metal fences come in many different types and styles. Which one of the following is not the more common types of metal fences?

prevnext
Answers
A
Copper
B
Cast Iron
C
Aluminum
D
Steel

One type of metal fence that is not as common as others is:
A. Copper.

Copper is a type of metal that is known for its durability, corrosion resistance, and attractive appearance. However, it is generally less commonly used for fencing than other types of metal such as steel, aluminum, or cast iron. Copper fences are typically more expensive than other types of metal fences due to the cost of the material and the time and labor required to fabricate and install them. They may be used in certain applications where their unique properties or appearance are desired, but they are not as commonly used as other types of metal fences. Steel, cast iron, and aluminum are all more common types of metal fences that are used in a variety of applications due to their strength, durability, and versatility.
